feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 3:39PM AKST until February 13 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 16 inches, with localized amounts up to 24 inches, are expected.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 11 at 1:38PM AKST until February 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 40 below zero to 50 below zero.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 5:36PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG SNOW SHOWER WILL AFFECT EASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY... At 534 PM MST, a strong snow shower was located 9 miles west of Bonny Reservoir, moving south at 40 mph. Visibility will quickly and briefly drop below one mile and produce a slippery roadway. Locations impacted include... Burlington and Bethune.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 3:03PM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. Snowfall amounts will be highly variable across the region. Although brief, snow will fall heavy at times with snowfall rates of up to 2 inches per hour.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 5:48PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS EARLY THIS EVENING... Winds early this evening will gust to around 35 to 45 MPH. These winds may lead to some difficulties with driving. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 6:02PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ARCTIC AIR EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND... An arctic air mass is expected to settle over the region this weekend. This cold air will freeze any lingering water or slush on area roads tonight and produce icy spots, especially over central and east-central Wisconsin. Motorists should use caution and slow down as black ice is difficult to see at night.
